meanings.sent1: The student was culpable for not completing the homework on time.
meanings.sent2: It is culpable to leave a mess behind for others to clean up.
meanings.sent3: The dog looked culpable after chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed culpable for the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: Her sad eyes made her culpable expression clear.

meanings.sent1: The culprit was found culpable for the crime.
meanings.sent2: He felt culpable for causing the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked culpable after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The broken mirror reflected his culpable face.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room made his culpable silence even more noticeable.
